Limited recycling infrastructure: In some areas, there may not be enough recycling facilities to handle the volume of waste generated, leading to contamination and inefficiency.
Cost: Recycling programs can be expensive to set up and maintain, which may deter some communities from participating.
Contamination: Improper disposal of non-recyclable items in recycling bins can lead to contamination and decrease the effectiveness of the recycling process.
Lack of education: People may not know what can be recycled or how to properly dispose of their waste, leading to contamination and inefficiency.
Limited access: Some communities may not have easy access to recycling facilities, making it difficult for residents to participate in the program.
